content.question: Three identical resistors <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, each with resistance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, are connected in a branch of a circuit, as shown in the figure. The equivalent resistance of the resistor combination shown is <math alttext="uppercase R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If Resistor <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is replaced by a resistor with resistance <math alttext="2 lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>r</mi></math>, what is the equivalent resistance of the new resistor combination?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half uppercase R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="two thirds uppercase R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="three halves uppercase R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="three halves uppercase R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
